The Second Divine Maiden’s Mansion, the Dutiful One
“A mansion of lapis lazuli, lovely and radiant,
with many decorations, you’ve ascended.
You shine there, divine maiden of great dignity,
displaying your various powers.
These celestial nymphs all around you
sing and dance and delight you.

analyzed: devi iddhipattā asi mahā anubhāve  manussa bhūtā kim akāsi puñña
translated: Divine maiden of great dignity, you’ve attained psychic power.🔽What merit did you make when you were a human being?
By what are you so radiant?

analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ ca te sabbadisā pabhāsati iti
translated: Your beauty shines in all directions.”
The deity was pleased,🔽and when asked by Moggallāna,
she answered the question
about the fruit of her deeds:
“When I was a human being,
I was a lay follower of the Buddha.
I refrained from killing living creatures
and avoided taking what was not given in the world.
